page.title: 10HEDGE SURVEY AT NANTGLYN 2.
page.content: The school hedge was a good site to study local ecology.Despite recent cutting plenty of flora and fauna could be observed.The most important flowers were: Cow Parsley Wild Geranium Red Campion Buttercup Greater Stitchwort Wild Rose Dead Nettle Charlock There were several unidentified types of grass. The foliage of the hedge was dense and it was an effective barrier to animals.No birds nests were seen but the following were present,robin wren, house martin, swallow,and blackbird. The sunny June weather encouraged a variety of insects: Caterpillars Red Admiral Butterfly Blackbeetle Cabbage White Butterfly Greenfly Wood Slater Wasp Wolf Spider Bladder Spider Earwig Crane Fly Ladybird Moth
